tp.pr2

Class ItemContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • tp.pr2.ItemContainer

  • public class ItemContainer
extends java.lang.Object

    A container of items. It can be employed by any class that stores items. A container cannot store two items with the same identifier

    It provides methods to add new items, access them and remove them from the container.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ItemContainer()
      Creates the empty container

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Add an item to the container.
      Item getItem(java.lang.String id)
      Returns the item from the container according to the item name
      int numberOfItems()
      Returns the number of items contained
      Item pickItem(java.lang.String id)
      Returns and deletes an item from the inventory.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Generates a String with information about the items contained in the container.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ItemContainer

        public ItemContainer()
        Creates the empty container

    • Method Detail

      • numberOfItems

        public int numberOfItems()
        Returns the number of items contained
        Returns:
        the number of items in the container

      • addItem

        public boolean addItem(Item item)
        Add an item to the container. The operation can fail, returning false
        Parameters:
        item - The name of the item to be added.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the item is added, i.e., an item with the same identifier does not exists in the container

      • getItem

        public Item getItem(java.lang.String id)
        Returns the item from the container according to the item name
        Parameters:
        id - Item name
        Returns:
        Item with that name or null if the container does not store an item with that name.

      • pickItem

        public Item pickItem(java.lang.String id)
        Returns and deletes an item from the inventory. This operation can fail, returning null
        Parameters:
        id - Name of the item
        Returns:
        An item if and only if the item identified by id exists in the inventory. Otherwise it returns null

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Generates a String with information about the items contained in the container. Note that the items must appear sorted but the item name.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
